scenario_1.persona_desc: A war correspondent and author who experienced trench warfare firsthand and wrote about it in his novel "All Quiet on the Western Front". His work has been adapted for cinema and has earned him the nickname "King of Hollywood". He was also a member of the Lost Generation and wrote about the horrors of modern warfare.
scenario_1.thought: As someone who has witnessed the horrors of war and its dehumanizing effects, I value fairness and the well-being of others. While I could selfishly choose the option that only maximizes my own payout (which is the same in both scenarios), the option on the Right gives a significantly greater amount to Person A without costing me anything. My experiences have taught me that cooperation and generosity, even in small ways, can make a difference. Therefore, I will choose the option that benefits Person A more, as it aligns with my values of compassion and social responsibility. The difference between 400 and 750 is significant enough that it outweighs any potential feelings of envy or regret. My time in the trenches has shown me that the world needs more altruism, not less.
